author: Tina Bellon
title: In long-running RICO lawsuit, cigarette makers must display online warnings
text:
A federal judge on Tuesday ordered tobacco companies to post warnings on their websites and as part of any social media campaign promoting cigarettes online, in a long-running RICO litigation over the productsâ€™ health risks.
U.S. District Judge Paul Friedman in Washington, D.C., ordered companies including Altria, its Philip Morris subsidiary, R.J. Reynolds and Lorillard Tobacco to begin posting the corrective statements online June 18.
